qas.question: At what century's start did revivalist fall into disfavor?
What new type of architecture was starting to come into being at this time?
When did the Deutscher Werkbund get its start?
What was the point of the Deutscher Werkbund?

answers.text: to produce better quality machine made objects

qas.question: In 1919 what school opened in Weimar, Germany?
At what century's end did revivalist fall into disfavor?
What old type of architecture was starting to come into being at this time?
When did the Deutscher Werkbund end?
In 1919 what business opened in Weimar, Germany?

context: Around the beginning of the <a0_0><b5_0>20th<b5_0/><a0_0/> century, a general dissatisfaction with the emphasis on revivalist architecture and elaborate decoration gave rise to many new lines of thought that served as precursors to <a1_0><b6_0>Modern Architecture<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Notable among these is the <b8_0>Deutscher Werkbund<b8_0/>, formed in <a2_0><b7_0>1907<b7_0/><a2_0/> <a3_0>to produce better quality machine made objects<a3_0/>. The rise of the profession of industrial design is usually placed here. Following this lead, <a4_0>the <b9_0>Bauhaus school<b9_0/><a4_0/>, founded in Weimar, Germany in 1919, redefined the architectural bounds prior set throughout history, viewing the creation of a building as the ultimate synthesis—the apex—of art, craft, and technology.
